Author: Wolf of RES#8148
Content:
Hiya! @polycryptoblog  everyone! üòÉ Introduced myself before in #talk-general  I am involved with https://resistance(dot)io (  exchange, ResDEX and contacting you on their behalf. I have reached out to individual projects within KMD ecosystem before but thought it best to interact with you guys directly.

We wish to position ourselves as 'One Stop exchange' for all privacy coins. For liquidity provision we have partnered with HUOBI & XRP market-makers. As a DEX we do not plan to charge listing fee for KMD or its asset chains. 

Happy to give contact information so we can discuss about this more with a developer from team, perhaps jl777?  Looking forward to cooperating! 

------
Short tldr;  ResDEX uses instant atomic swaps (within 30 sec trades at the moment) for decentralized trading (using RES as collateral) and zk-Snarks for Privacy.
TOR routing is supported natively as well on ResDEX.  RES coin itself is CPU mineable through yespower algo (rewards split between 30% Proof of Research, 30% Proof of Work, 30% Masternodes & 10% for development)  and anyone can check out working prototype for POR through https://respool.io/

P.S Would partners@komodoplatform. com be the best way to reach out to you guys? : )

Author: polycryptoblog#1173
Content: Yes

Author: polycryptoblog#1173
Content: Send the information to partners@komodoplatform.com I will go through all the information and get back to you to discuss further

Author: Wolf of RES#8148
Content: Awesome! Thanks for quick response Poly! Will contact you through there. Looking forward to discussing!

Author: Wolf of RES#8148
Content:
As an added question @polycryptoblog  we are also interested in listing multiple sub-chains (that obviously support atomic swap (probably rules out ARRR  :/ ) ). If possible; can you send me leads for them or suggest best possible way to reach out? 

I would assume that every project within KMD ecosystem would have its own requirements for listing and point of contact?

Author: polycryptoblog#1173
Content: The ecosystem section of this discord has all the projects associated .  I do not think anyone will object to a listing on an exchange  if it‚Äôs free.

Author: Wolf of RES#8148
Content:
Yea I thought so as well! Thank you for all assistance @polycryptoblog  , will be keeping you updated! 
P.S You can also tune in to our exchange demo scheduled today to get idea about interface etc. Here's the tweet for it !  (hope I am not being too intrusive by sharing link)

https://twitter.com/paperstreetvc/status/1093721794228469761

Author: wil#2080
Content:
@Malti
Kasper from Guts was in a Dutch broadcast yesterday. He said that they had choosen for Ethereum because that was the only one with a smart contract at that time. Whether they experienced limits on Ethereum, the answer was yes and no.

He told that there are indeed better blockchains at the moment, but that they do not want to choose a blockchain too early. They do not want to focus on Komodo or another one yet. Komodo, because of the high transactions would possible be a good reason he said, but they first want to look at how they can use the blockchain. Which applications are needed and only then see which chain fits the best for them.

He said: Why choose Komodo, consider because of the high transaction could be a reason but do we need it or can we do it smarter.

He really needs to do some homework I think! üòÄ

Author: polycryptoblog#1173
Content:
If the multiple-signature wallet provider restricts its role to creating un-hosted
wallets that require adding a second authorization key to the wallet owner‚Äôs private
key in order to validate and complete transactions, the provider is not a money
transmitter because it does not accept and transmit value.56
56. 31 CFR ¬ß 1010.100(ff)(5)(ii)(A).
 On the other hand, if the
person combines the services of a multiple-signature wallet provider and a hosted
wallet provider, that person will then qualify as a money transmitter. Likewise,
if the value is represented as an entry in the accounts of the provider, the owner
does not interact with the payment system directly, or the provider maintains
total independent control of the value, the provider will also qualify as a money
transmitter, regardless of the label the person applies to itself or its activities.
